ray.rage.scene.generic

Class GenericLight

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.scene.generic.AbstractGenericSceneObject
      • ray.rage.scene.generic.GenericLight
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable, Managed<SceneManager>, Nameable, Visible, Light, SceneObject

    final class GenericLight
extends AbstractGenericSceneObject
implements Light
    A generic light.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

      • setType

        public void setType(Light.Type type)
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Sets the type of this light.

        This call has the following side-effects on the light's cone cutoff angle, based on the chosen type:

        • Light.Type.DIRECTIONAL: No side-effects. Cutoff angle not used.
        • Light.Type.POINT: Sets Light.setConeCutoffAngle(Angle) to 180 degrees, which is a special case.
        • Light.Type.SPOT: Sets Light.setConeCutoffAngle(Angle) to a default value of 45 degrees, which is in the [0, 90) degree range.
        Specified by:
        setType in interface Light
        Parameters:
        type - The type.
        See Also:
        Light.setConeCutoffAngle(Angle)

      • setRange

        public void setRange(float value)
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Sets how "far" rays emitted by this source of light can reach.

        The range is the maximum distance (i.e. number of world-units) a ray can "travel" before it can no longer illuminate other scene-objects. SceneObjects beyond the range of this light do not get lit.

        This value only affects point and spot lights.

        Specified by:
        setRange in interface Light
        Parameters:
        value - The range.

      • getRange

        public float getRange()
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Gets the range of this light.

        This value only affects point and spot lights.

        Specified by:
        getRange in interface Light
        Returns:
        The range.

      • setConstantAttenuation

        public void setConstantAttenuation(float value)
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Sets the value of the constant coefficient in the attenuation formula.

        The larger this value is the faster light gets dimmer regardless of distance to the object being illuminated. This value is not scaled by the distance; it's used "as is".

        Note that, while this coefficient can be independently set to zero, it must not be set to zero at the same time as the other coefficients.

        This value only affects point and spot lights.

        Specified by:
        setConstantAttenuation in interface Light
        Parameters:
        value - The constant coefficient.

      • getConstantAttenuation

        public float getConstantAttenuation()
        Description copied from interface: Light

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The constant coefficient.
        See Also:
        Light.setConstantAttenuation(float)

      • setLinearAttenuation

        public void setLinearAttenuation(float value)
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Sets the value of the linear coefficient in the attenuation formula.

        The larger this value is the faster light gets dimmer. This value is proportional (i.e. linear) to the distance between this light and object being illuminated.

        Note that, while this coefficient can be independently set to zero, it must not be set to zero at the same time as the other coefficients.

        This value only affects point and spot lights.

        Specified by:
        setLinearAttenuation in interface Light
        Parameters:
        value - The linear coefficient.

      • getLinearAttenuation

        public float getLinearAttenuation()
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Gets the linear coefficient.
        Specified by:
        getLinearAttenuation in interface Light
        Returns:
        The linear coefficient.
        See Also:
        Light.setLinearAttenuation(float)

      • setQuadraticAttenuation

        public void setQuadraticAttenuation(float value)
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Sets the value of the quadratic coefficient in the attenuation formula.

        The larger this value is the faster light gets dimmer. This value is scaled by the squared distance to the object being illuminated.

        Note that, while this coefficient can be independently set to zero, it must not be set to zero at the same time as the other coefficients.

        This value only affects point and spot lights.

        Specified by:
        setQuadraticAttenuation in interface Light
        Parameters:
        value - The quadratic coefficient.

      • getQuadraticAttenuation

        public float getQuadraticAttenuation()
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Gets the quadratic coefficient.
        Specified by:
        getQuadraticAttenuation in interface Light
        Returns:
        The quadratic coefficient.
        See Also:
        Light.setQuadraticAttenuation(float)

      • setConeCutoffAngle

        public void setConeCutoffAngle(Angle angle)
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Sets the angle of this light's cone of illumination, as measured relative to a ray cast from the cone's center in the direction it's pointing.

        The cutoff angle must be within the [0, 90), 180 degree range, where 180 is a special case for point lights

        All scene-objects outside of this light's cone of illumination remain unlit by this source.

        This value only affects spot lights.

        Specified by:
        setConeCutoffAngle in interface Light
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle.

      • getConeCutoffAngle

        public Angle getConeCutoffAngle()
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Gets the angle of this light's cone of illumination.
        Specified by:
        getConeCutoffAngle in interface Light
        Returns:
        The angle.
        See Also:
        Light.setConeCutoffAngle(Angle)

      • setFalloffExponent

        public void setFalloffExponent(float falloff)
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Sets the value of the falloff coefficient for this light.

        This value is used to calculate how scene-objects are illuminated as their angle relative to the cone's center increases, i.e. as they get further away from it and get closer to the "edge" of the cone. The larger this value, the faster this light's rays will attenuate as it gets closer to its cuttoff angle.

        This value only affects spot lights.

        Specified by:
        setFalloffExponent in interface Light
        Parameters:
        falloff - The falloff coefficient.

      • getFalloffExponent

        public float getFalloffExponent()
        Description copied from interface: Light
        Gets the falloff coefficient for this light.
        Specified by:
        getFalloffExponent in interface Light
        Returns:
        The falloff coefficient.
        See Also:
        Light.setFalloffExponent(float)
